meals.name:
Toast With Refried Beans
and Avocado
meals.instruction:
Toast bread to the desired level of doneness.
Top with refried beans, avocado (mash with a fork if
desired) and sprinkle with salt.
Serve and enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Chicken thighs, with skin (Organic if

available)

meals.name: Smoked Paprika & Turmeric Roast Chicken Thighs
meals.instruction:
Make marinade: Add olive oil, lime juice, ginger, turmeric,
garlic, smoked paprika, salt and sumac and whisk until
everything is combined.
Wash chicken and pat dry and put in a Ziploc bag, add all of
the marinade, close bag and massage until every piece of
chicken is covered with the marinade. Put chicken in the
fridge and let marinate for at least 24 hours.
Next day:
Pre-heat oven to 350�F and line a deep baking dish with
parchment paper. Pour the chicken plus marinade into the
baking sheet and bake for 2 hours
uncovered. When cooked remove from baking dish and put
on a serving platter, drizzle some of the pan juices on the
chicken thighs & and serve with your side of choice such as
Quinoa OR Rice.....YUMMY.

meals.name:
Sliced Apples & Almond
Butter
meals.instruction:
1. Slice apple and sprinkle slices with cinnamon.

2. Dip in almond butter for a blood sugar balancing snack.
Enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Atlantic salmon, wild (cut into 6 pieces

or 1 large piece)

meals.name: Salmon with Avocado Salsa Oven Baked
meals.instruction:
Pre-heat the oven to 400 degrees.
Mix the cumin, paprika, garlic powder, black pepper, and
a 1/4 pinch of sea salt.
Coat the salmon with olive oil, the seasoning mix, and the
sliced onions.
Next, cover the pan with a glass lid (parchment paper and
then aluminum foil on top, so the toxins from the aluminum
don't go in the fish).
Place in the oven and cook until done, about 15-20 minutes
depending on the thickness of the fish.
Avocado Salsa
Combine the avocado, onion*, cilantro, lime juice, and 1/2
pinch of sea salt in a bowl and mix well,
Raw onion can be hard to digest. If you are healing
your gut either sautee or steam the onion or leave them
out.
Top the cooked salmon with avocado salsa and enjoy!

meals.name: Blueberry Smoothie Bowl
meals.instruction:
Blend all smoothie ingredients together. Pour into bowls.
Top with fresh fruit, nuts and seeds of your choice. I used
mango, strawberries, banana, blueberries, chia seeds and
granola.
Enjoy!

meals.instruction:
Toss ingredients in a large bowl. Mix dressing ingredients
separately then add. Its flavour gets better as it has a
chance to infuse a little.

ingredients.name:
Kale (de-stemmed and torn into pieces
- they will shrink in the dehydrator)

Cashew nuts, raw (or sunflower seeds -

soaked for 2 hours)

meals.name: Nacho Flavoured Kale Chips
meals.instruction:
Chop the red pepper into chunks and add to a blender with
the lemon juice. Blend until the pepper is broken down.
Add the cashews or sunflower seeds, red chili pepper flakes
and salt and again blend until smooth.
Add the nutritional yeast and blend again. Doing it in stages
like this helps you to get the smooth consistency you need
without over-heating it.
Put the kale in a large bowl then pour the blended mixture
over it and massage it in until all the leaves are coated.
Place it on dehydrator trays on mesh sheets and dehydrate
at 110 degrees Fahrenheit for about 8 hrs, turning once
halfway through. If they aren�t crispy enough, leave them in
a bit longer.
If you don't have a dehydrator, you can also roast your kale
chips in a 350-degree oven for 10 to 15 minutes. You run
the risk of them becoming a bit soggy with tis method,
however.
Note:
Cook time reflects cooking in the oven.

meals.name: Protein Parfait
meals.instruction:
Combine ingredients, topping with berries.
Serve and enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Baby spinach (or any greens you

prefer)

Frozen raspberries (or any fruit you

prefer)

meals.name: Balanced Green Smoothie
meals.instruction:
Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth
and pour into a tall clear glass.
Feel free to switch up the raspberries and greens for
alternatives.

ingredients.name:
Chicken breast, boneless, skinless (cut

into 1-inch cubes)

meals.name: Keto Grilled Pesto Chicken and Tomato Kebabs
meals.instruction:
In a food processor pulse basil, garlic, parmesan
cheese, salt and pepper until smooth. Slowly add the
olive oil while pulsing. Reserve 2-3 tbsp pesto in a
separate bowl.
Combine the raw chicken with the rest of the pesto
and marinate a few hours in a bowl.
Soak wooden skewers in water at least 30 minutes
(or use metal ones to avoid this step).
Beginning and ending with chicken, thread chicken
and tomatoes onto 8 pairs of parallel skewers to
make 8 kebabs total.
Heat the outdoor grill or indoor grill pan over
medium heat until hot. Be sure the grates are clean
and spray lightly with oil.
Place the chicken on the hot grill and cook about 3-4
minutes. Turn and continue cooking until chicken is
cooked through, about 2 to 3 minutes. Brush with
the reserved pesto.

ingredients.name: Extra virgin olive oil (for frying fish)
Extra virgin olive oil (for pan sauce)

Italian herb seasoning, McCormick
(dried thyme; oregano; parsley)

meals.name:
Trout with Garlic Lemon
Butter Herb Sauce
meals.instruction:
Generously season both sides of fish fillets with
Italian herb seasoning, salt, and pepper.
In a large skillet (large enough to fit 2 fish fillets),
heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil on medium heat until
heated but not smoking. To the hot skillet with olive
oil, add fish fillets skin side up - flesh side down.
Cook the flesh side of the fish for about 3-5 minutes
on medium heat, making sure the oil does not
smoke, until lightly browned. Flip the fillets over to
the other side, skin side down (add more oil, if
needed). Cook for another 2-4 minutes. Remove the
skillet from heat, close with the lid, and let the fish
sit for 5-10 minutes, covered, in the skillet, until
flaky and cooked through completely.
After the fish is cooked through, using spatula,
carefully remove fillets to the plate, making sure to
leave all the cooking oils in the pan.
Add 1 tsp oil to the same pan with minced garlic,
lemon juice, and white wine. Cook on medium-low
heat for about 1 minute, until garlic softens a bit.
Remove from heat. Add 1 tablespoon of chopped
parsley, and 1 tablespoons of butter, off heat, to the
sauce, stirring, until the butter melts and forms a
creamy mixture.
Add fish to the pan, spoon sauce over the fish, top
the fish and sauce with the remaining 1 tablespoon
of parsley, and serve.

meals.name:
Blueberry, Almond and
Feta Salad
meals.instruction:
Combine romaine, blueberries, cucumber, feta and
almonds in a large bowl.
Whisk together Dijon mustard, balsamic vinegar,
maple syrup and salt. Slowly pour in olive oil
whisking until completely combined and emulsified.
Portion the salad and top with 1�2 tablespoons of
dressing.

2. Add two tablespoons of muesli to a bowl and add 1/4 cup
almond milk, 1 tablespoon of Greek yoghurt (or coconut
yogurt if you want to go dairy free), and 1/4 cup of frozen
berries, defrosted.
Enjoy!

meals.name: Crispy Roasted Chickpeas
meals.instruction:
Heat the oven to 400�F: Place an oven rack in the
middle of the oven.
Rinse and drain the chickpeas: Open the cans of
chickpeas and pour the chickpeas into a strainer in
the sink. Rinse thoroughly under running water.
Dry the chickpeas: Pat the chickpeas very dry with a
clean dishtowel or paper towels. They should look
matte and feel dry to the touch; if you have time,
leave them to air-dry for a few minutes. Remove any
chickpea skins that come off while drying, but
otherwise don�t worry about them.
Toss the chickpeas with olive oil and salt: Spread the
chickpeas out in an even layer on the baking sheet.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Stir with
your hands or a spatula to make sure the chickpeas
are evenly coated.
Roast the chickpeas in the oven for 20 to 30
minutes: Stir the chickpeas or shake the pan every
10 minutes. A few chickpeas may pop � that�s
normal. The chickpeas are done when golden and
slightly darkened, dry and crispy on the outside, and
soft in the middle.
Toss the chickpeas with the spices: Sprinkle the
spices over the chickpeas and stir to coat evenly.
Serve while the chickpeas are still warm and crispy.
They will gradually lose their crispiness as they cool,
becoming addictively chewy.
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Chickpeas, raw 2/3 cup
Instructions:
Place the chickpeas in a bowl and cover with
plenty of water. Let soak for at least 8 hours, or
overnight. Drain and rinse well. Place in a large
pot, cover with water, bring to a boil and reduce to
simmer with the lid on for about 50 minutes. Drain
and store in a glass Tupperware in the fridge.

meals.name: Mezze Bowls
meals.instruction:
Heat oven 425 F.
Slice zucchini, bell peppers, red onion and delicata squash
into even-sized pieces. Coat baking sheets in olive oil and
arrange vegetables on baking sheets. Place in the oven to
roast- about 15-20 minutes.
Make the hummus dressing by combining hummus, lemon
juice, olive oil, salt and pepper.
Combine chickpeas and hot sauce of choice in a small bowl.
Combine vegetables and chickpeas in a pan and add
spinach just long enough to wilt.
Arrange quinoa, spinach and roasted vegetables in bowls.
Top with chickpeas, hummus dressing and a sprinkling of
cilantro and any herbs of choice.

meals.name: Chia Fresca
meals.instruction:
Place chia and water in a large mason and shake vigorously.
Add remaining ingredients and shake again. Let sit for 10
min. Shake vigorously again to remove any clumps (this is
normal) and enjoy!
Pro tip: with stress comes inflammation in the body. This
can aggravate fatigue and cause aches and pains. Try
adding a scoop of clean bone broth protein OR collagen
peptides to your Chia water. It is flavorless and a potent
anti-inflammatory. Superfoods for the win!

meals.name:
Green Beans with Walnuts
and Onions
meals.instruction:
Cut off green beans ends, boil green beans 3-4 minutes.
In a large skillet, heat half of the olive oil over medium heat
and cook onions, stirring, for 5 minutes. Add walnuts and
garlic and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes.
Add the remaining oil and green beans. Season with salt
and pepper, stir and cook for 2 minutes.
Serve as an appetizer or with parboiled rice to make a
complete meal.

meals.name: Italian Orzo Salad
meals.instruction:
1. Wash and slice the spinach, basil, and mushrooms and
chop sun dried tomatoes. Place in the bottom of a pasta
strainer.
2.
A) If pasta was made ahead of time: Reheat reserved
cooking water in the microwave and pour over the
vegetable in the strainer (this will slightly cook them & add
some starchiness). Continue to step 3.
B) If pasta was not made ahead of time: Cook the orzo
according to package directions. When ready to drain, pour
the whole pot, orzo with water, over the veggies in the
bottom of the pasta strainer (this will slightly cook them &
add some starchiness).
3. Place pasta and vegetables in a big bowl. Add the rest of
the ingredients into the bowl and mix until well combined.
Portion into 4 mason jars and enjoy!
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Orzo, dry 567 gm
Instructions:
Cook the orzo according to package directions.
Drain, but reserve 1 cup of pasta water. Add 1 tsp
of olive oil to pasta to prevent sticking and store in
an airtight container in the fridge.

Sweet Potato Toast with
Almond Butter & Banana
meals.instruction:
Slice sweet potatoes lengthwise into 1/4 inch slices. Add to
the toaster like you would bread and toast on high. It may
take 2 rounds to get it cooked with a little bit a browning on
both sides.
Spread some almond butter on toast and add sliced banana
and a bit of cinnamon.
Enjoy!

juice, olive oil, salt and pepper.
Combine chickpeas and hot sauce of choice in a small bowl.
Combine vegetables and chickpeas in a pan and add
spinach just long enough to wilt.
Arrange quinoa, spinach and roasted vegetables in bowls.
Top with chickpeas, hummus dressing and a sprinkling of
cilantro and any herbs of choice.

meals.name:
Green Beans with Walnuts
and Onions
meals.instruction:
Cut off green beans ends, boil green beans 3-4 minutes.
In a large skillet, heat half of the olive oil over medium heat
and cook onions, stirring, for 5 minutes. Add walnuts and
garlic and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes.
Add the remaining oil and green beans. Season with salt
and pepper, stir and cook for 2 minutes.
Serve as an appetizer or with parboiled rice to make a
complete meal.

ingredients.name:
Lettuce, romaine (chopped; or baby
spinach; or mixed greens)

meals.name:
Blueberry, Almond and
Feta Salad
meals.instruction:
Combine romaine, blueberries, cucumber, feta and
almonds in a large bowl.
Whisk together Dijon mustard, balsamic vinegar,
maple syrup and salt. Slowly pour in olive oil
whisking until completely combined and emulsified.
Portion the salad and top with 1�2 tablespoons of
dressing.

meals.name: Hormone Balancing Granola
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 180�F.
Chop Brazil nuts and pecans in a food processor. Mix in a
bowl with all the other nuts, seeds, and coconut flakes.
Combine melted coconut oil, maple syrup, vanilla extract,
and cinnamon. Pour into the dry ingredients and mix until
everything is well-coated.
Place in the oven to cook for 30 minutes.

ingredients.name:
Salsa, ready-to-serve, low sodium, hot/

medium

meals.name: Eggs and Toast
meals.instruction:
1. How to Hard Boil an Egg
2. Once your egg is boiled, peel and slice!
3. Toast your bread in the toasted to desired crispiness.
4. Add boiled eggs and salsa on top and Enjoy!

meals.instruction:
Combine everything in a blender until smooth.

meals.name:
Toast With Refried Beans
and Avocado
meals.instruction:
Toast bread to the desired level of doneness.
Top with refried beans, avocado (mash with a fork if
desired) and sprinkle with salt.
Serve and enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Curly kale (Lacinato or whatever variety

you prefer)

White balsamic vinegar (or white wine

vinegar)

meals.name: Kale and Cabbage Slaw
meals.instruction:
Cut the middle rib out of each kale leaf. Roll the

leaves up into a tight roll and slice them chiffonade-
style into thin strips. Put the strips of kale in a large

bowl. You should have about 2 to 3 cups.
Cut the core out of the cabbage half and thinly shred
cabbage on a mandolin use a knife to thinly chop it.
Transfer the cabbage to the bowl with the kale.
Wash and peel the carrots. Julienne them into thin
matchstick (you can use a mandolin or a knife). Add
to the kale and cabbage.
Drizzle 2 to 3 tablespoons of the dressing over the
salad. Toss the salad. Cover and refrigerate until
serving time. Serve with the extra dressing on the
side.
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Dijon mustard, whole grain
3/4 tsp
Instructions:
In a mason jar or bowl, combine the Dijon mustard,
minced garlic, vinegar, and mayo. Whisk or shake
well. Add a dash of salt and some freshly ground
black pepper, to taste.

meals.name: Hard Boiled Eggs
meals.instruction:
1. Place eggs in saucepan and cover with water. Bring to
boil over high heat.
2. Once boiling, turn off heat but keep saucepan on the
burner. Cover and let sit for 10-12 minutes.
3. Strain the water and fill the saucepan with cold water. Let
eggs sit until cool enough to handle.
4. Peel off the shell and cut eggs as you wish, sprinkle salt
and pepper to taste

ingredients.name:
Chickpeas, canned, low sodium
(drained, but reserve 2 tbsp chickpea
water; for hummus)
Sea salt, fine (to taste; for hummus)

Feta cheese (or leave whole as a large
block)

meals.name:
Mediterranean Hummus
Bowl
meals.instruction:
In a bowl place together: greens, tomatoes, olives,
chickpeas, feta and a large scoop of hummus.
Sprinkle with lemon juice and drizzle with olive oil
Season with salt, pepper and oregano. Enjoy!
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Chickpeas, canned, low
sodium 1 cup
Instructions:
Turn on the food processor, drop the garlic down
the food tube, and process until minced.
After the garlic is fully processed, then add the
remaining ingredients to the processor and process
until you get the consistency you like
Check the seasoning and if needed you may add
more salt or lemon juice

ingredients.name:
Cumin (or other favorite spices and

herbs)

Garlic powder (or other favorite spices

and herbs)

Paprika, smoked (or other favorite

spices and herbs)

Chili powder (or other favorite spices

and herbs)

meals.name: Crispy Roasted Chickpeas
meals.instruction:
Heat the oven to 400�F: Place an oven rack in the
middle of the oven.
Rinse and drain the chickpeas: Open the cans of
chickpeas and pour the chickpeas into a strainer in
the sink. Rinse thoroughly under running water.
Dry the chickpeas: Pat the chickpeas very dry with a
clean dishtowel or paper towels. They should look
matte and feel dry to the touch; if you have time,
leave them to air-dry for a few minutes. Remove any
chickpea skins that come off while drying, but
otherwise don�t worry about them.
Toss the chickpeas with olive oil and salt: Spread the
chickpeas out in an even layer on the baking sheet.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Stir with
your hands or a spatula to make sure the chickpeas
are evenly coated.
Roast the chickpeas in the oven for 20 to 30
minutes: Stir the chickpeas or shake the pan every
10 minutes. A few chickpeas may pop � that�s
normal. The chickpeas are done when golden and
slightly darkened, dry and crispy on the outside, and
soft in the middle.
Toss the chickpeas with the spices: Sprinkle the
spices over the chickpeas and stir to coat evenly.
Serve while the chickpeas are still warm and crispy.
They will gradually lose their crispiness as they cool,
becoming addictively chewy.
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Chickpeas, raw 2/3 cup
Instructions:
Place the chickpeas in a bowl and cover with
plenty of water. Let soak for at least 8 hours, or
overnight. Drain and rinse well. Place in a large
pot, cover with water, bring to a boil and reduce to
simmer with the lid on for about 50 minutes. Drain
and store in a glass Tupperware in the fridge.

meals.name:
Toast With Refried Beans
and Avocado
meals.instruction:
Toast bread to the desired level of doneness.
Top with refried beans, avocado (mash with a fork if
desired) and sprinkle with salt.
Serve and enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Baby spinach (or any greens you

prefer)

Frozen raspberries (or any fruit you

prefer)

meals.name: Balanced Green Smoothie
meals.instruction:
Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth
and pour into a tall clear glass.
Feel free to switch up the raspberries and greens for
alternatives.

meals.name:
Sliced Apples & Almond
Butter
meals.instruction:
1. Slice apple and sprinkle slices with cinnamon.

2. Dip in almond butter for a blood sugar balancing snack.
Enjoy!

meals.instruction:

ingredients.name:
Greek yogurt, plain, 5% M.F., Liberte (or
use plain coconut yogurt - dairy free)

Almond milk, chocolate, unsweetened,

Blue Diamond

meals.name: Raw Muesli with Greek Yoghurt and Berries
meals.instruction:
1. Add ingredients to suitable glass container and mix well.
2. Add two tablespoons of muesli to a bowl and add 1/4 cup
almond milk, 1 tablespoon of Greek yoghurt (or coconut
yogurt if you want to go dairy free), and 1/4 cup of frozen
berries, defrosted.
Enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Chicken thighs, with skin (Organic if

available)

meals.name: Smoked Paprika & Turmeric Roast Chicken Thighs
meals.instruction:
Make marinade: Add olive oil, lime juice, ginger, turmeric,
garlic, smoked paprika, salt and sumac and whisk until
everything is combined.
Wash chicken and pat dry and put in a Ziploc bag, add all of
the marinade, close bag and massage until every piece of
chicken is covered with the marinade. Put chicken in the
fridge and let marinate for at least 24 hours.
Next day:
Pre-heat oven to 350�F and line a deep baking dish with
parchment paper. Pour the chicken plus marinade into the
baking sheet and bake for 2 hours
uncovered. When cooked remove from baking dish and put
on a serving platter, drizzle some of the pan juices on the
chicken thighs & and serve with your side of choice such as
Quinoa OR Rice.....YUMMY.

meals.name:
Butternut, Carrot & Leek
Quiche with Quinoa Crust
meals.instruction:
Preheat the oven to 400 (F). Grease a 9 inch tart pan with coconut oil (or oil of choice).
For the crust: Combine the flax and water in a small bowl and set aside to thicken. Stir together the cooked quinoa, nutritional
yeast, coconut oil, and herbs. Add the flax mixture and mix until well combined. Press the mixture into prepared tart pan using your
hands. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden. Turn the oven heat down to 350 (F).
For the filling: In a large pan, heat coconut oil over medium-high heat. Add the garlic, leeks, carrots, and butternut squash. Saute,
stirring frequently, until carrots and squash are tender (about 8-10 minutes). Add spinach and stir until wilted. Remove pan from
heat. In a food processor, combine the remaining ingredients until very smooth. Transfer creamy mixture to a bowl and stir in
sauteed veggies. Spread the filling over the prepared crust and bake for about 35 minutes (the top should be golden). Garnish with
fresh sage. Allow to cool for at least 10 minutes before slicing.
Enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Kale (de-stemmed and torn into pieces
- they will shrink in the dehydrator)

Cashew nuts, raw (or sunflower seeds -

soaked for 2 hours)

meals.name: Nacho Flavoured Kale Chips
meals.instruction:
Chop the red pepper into chunks and add to a blender with
the lemon juice. Blend until the pepper is broken down.
Add the cashews or sunflower seeds, red chili pepper flakes
and salt and again blend until smooth.
Add the nutritional yeast and blend again. Doing it in stages
like this helps you to get the smooth consistency you need
without over-heating it.
Put the kale in a large bowl then pour the blended mixture
over it and massage it in until all the leaves are coated.
Place it on dehydrator trays on mesh sheets and dehydrate
at 110 degrees Fahrenheit for about 8 hrs, turning once
halfway through. If they aren�t crispy enough, leave them in
a bit longer.
If you don't have a dehydrator, you can also roast your kale
chips in a 350-degree oven for 10 to 15 minutes. You run
the risk of them becoming a bit soggy with tis method,
however.
Note:
Cook time reflects cooking in the oven.

ingredients.name:
Chicken breast, boneless, skinless (cut

into 1-inch cubes)

meals.name: Keto Grilled Pesto Chicken and Tomato Kebabs
meals.instruction:
In a food processor pulse basil, garlic, parmesan
cheese, salt and pepper until smooth. Slowly add the
olive oil while pulsing. Reserve 2-3 tbsp pesto in a
separate bowl.
Combine the raw chicken with the rest of the pesto
and marinate a few hours in a bowl.
Soak wooden skewers in water at least 30 minutes
(or use metal ones to avoid this step).
Beginning and ending with chicken, thread chicken
and tomatoes onto 8 pairs of parallel skewers to
make 8 kebabs total.
Heat the outdoor grill or indoor grill pan over
medium heat until hot. Be sure the grates are clean
and spray lightly with oil.
Place the chicken on the hot grill and cook about 3-4
minutes. Turn and continue cooking until chicken is
cooked through, about 2 to 3 minutes. Brush with
the reserved pesto.

ingredients.name:
Atlantic salmon, wild (cut into 6 pieces

or 1 large piece)

meals.name: Salmon with Avocado Salsa Oven Baked
meals.instruction:
Pre-heat the oven to 400 degrees.
Mix the cumin, paprika, garlic powder, black pepper, and
a 1/4 pinch of sea salt.
Coat the salmon with olive oil, the seasoning mix, and the
sliced onions.
Next, cover the pan with a glass lid (parchment paper and
then aluminum foil on top, so the toxins from the aluminum
don't go in the fish).
Place in the oven and cook until done, about 15-20 minutes
depending on the thickness of the fish.
Avocado Salsa
Combine the avocado, onion*, cilantro, lime juice, and 1/2
pinch of sea salt in a bowl and mix well,
Raw onion can be hard to digest. If you are healing
your gut either sautee or steam the onion or leave them
out.
Top the cooked salmon with avocado salsa and enjoy!

meals.name: Chia Fresca
meals.instruction:
Place chia and water in a large mason and shake vigorously.
Add remaining ingredients and shake again. Let sit for 10
min. Shake vigorously again to remove any clumps (this is
normal) and enjoy!
Pro tip: with stress comes inflammation in the body. This
can aggravate fatigue and cause aches and pains. Try
adding a scoop of clean bone broth protein OR collagen
peptides to your Chia water. It is flavorless and a potent
anti-inflammatory. Superfoods for the win!

meals.instruction:
Blend all smoothie ingredients together. Pour into bowls.
Top with fresh fruit, nuts and seeds of your choice. I used
mango, strawberries, banana, blueberries, chia seeds and
granola.
Enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Partly skimmed milk, 2% M.F. (or
unsweetened soy milk)

meals.name:
Savory Spinach Steel Cut
Oatmeal
meals.instruction:
In a pot on the stove, bring milk and water to a boil
over high heat. Add steel-cut oats and return to a
boil.
Reduce the heat to low and stir ever couple of
minutes- it should barely bubble. Simmer for 20-25
minutes, until the oats are tender and creamy but
still have a bit of a bite.
Chop the spinach a bit and add it to the pot along
with the sea salt or Herbamere. Give everything a
stir and let the spinach wilt for a few minutes while
you prepare the eggs.
Fry your eggs to your liking and slice up the grape
tomatoes.
Assemble bowls by portioning 1/4 of the oat mixture
into a bowl, topping it with a fried egg, sliced
tomatoes, and a sprinkle of hemp hearts.

Add 2 tbsp oil to pan on a high heat
Once heated, add your chopped onion, garlic, chilli
and scallions. Cook for 2 minutes
Chop your red pepper into strips, broccoli into florets
and tomatoes into quarters and add to pan. Cook for
2 minutes and add the cumin seeds while the
broccoli starts to char
Pour in the coconut milk and chopped tomatoes with
the curry powder, salt, pepper and maple syrup.
Chop in the coriander along with the peas
Serve with a sprinkling of roasted cashews!

meals.name:
AMAZING Black Bean
Brownies
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees and grease 8x8 baking pan.
Pulse oats in food processor until it creates a course or finer
flour.
Add all ingredients (except chocolate chips and process
until well mixed.
Mix in chocolate chips.
Spread mixture into a greased pan and bake for 15 minutes.
Toss in the fridge for 15 minutes to firm up if needed.

meals.name: Omega-3 Maple Almond Butter
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees and line a baking sheet with
parchment paper.
Toss almonds with maple syrup, to coat, and spread in an
even layer on lined baking sheet.
Roast in oven 10 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool.
Place roasted almonds, flax, chia, and hemp seeds in the
bowl of a food processor and process until smooth and the
oils have released. Add in coconut oil, cinnamon, and salt.
Process until almond butter reaches desired texture. Store
in a lidded jar in fridge, 2 weeks.
Note:
This recipe makes 2 cups. There are 32 tbsp. in 2 cups.
Serving size is based on 2 tbsp. per serving.

Roast in oven 10 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool.

Toast With Refried Beans
and Avocado
meals.instruction:
Toast bread to the desired level of doneness.
Top with refried beans, avocado (mash with a fork if
desired) and sprinkle with salt.
Serve and enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Pasta, macaroni, elbow, whole wheat,

cooked

Red bell pepper (chopped, optional for
color)

meals.name:
Best Ever Vegan Mac &
Cheese
meals.instruction:
Place cashews in the food processor and finely grind
(just don�t let the cashews turn to a cashew butter).
Add red pepper and process until smooth. Set aside.
In a heavy saucepan, combine milk, oil and
cornstarch. Bring to a simmer over high heat.
Decrease heat to low, cover and simmer, stirring
occasionally for 10 minutes, or until cornstarch
dissolves.
Using a whisk or large fork, stir in the ground
cashews, nutritional yeast, miso paste, lemon juice,
onion powder, garlic powder and salt until well
combined.
Add the cashew cheese to the macaroni noodles,
drizzle with truffle oil (if using), a dash of freshly
ground black pepper and serve.

ingredients.name:
Nuts, mixed nuts, dry
roasted with peanuts,
salted

meals.name:
Nuts, mixed nuts, dry
roasted with peanuts,
salted

ingredients.name:
Chicken breast, boneless, skinless (cut

into 1-inch cubes)

meals.name: Keto Grilled Pesto Chicken and Tomato Kebabs
meals.instruction:
In a food processor pulse basil, garlic, parmesan
cheese, salt and pepper until smooth. Slowly add the
olive oil while pulsing. Reserve 2-3 tbsp pesto in a
separate bowl.
Combine the raw chicken with the rest of the pesto
and marinate a few hours in a bowl.
Soak wooden skewers in water at least 30 minutes
(or use metal ones to avoid this step).
Beginning and ending with chicken, thread chicken
and tomatoes onto 8 pairs of parallel skewers to
make 8 kebabs total.
Heat the outdoor grill or indoor grill pan over
medium heat until hot. Be sure the grates are clean
and spray lightly with oil.
Place the chicken on the hot grill and cook about 3-4
minutes. Turn and continue cooking until chicken is
cooked through, about 2 to 3 minutes. Brush with
the reserved pesto.

meals.name: Brain-Adrenal Balancing Smoothie
meals.instruction:
Combine everything in a blender until smooth.
Serve and enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Coconut water, unsweetened, ready-to-
drink (or water)

Maple syrup (or sweetener of your

choice)

meals.name: Chia Fresca
meals.instruction:
Place chia and water in a large mason and shake vigorously.
Add remaining ingredients and shake again. Let sit for 10
min. Shake vigorously again to remove any clumps (this is
normal) and enjoy!
Pro tip: with stress comes inflammation in the body. This
can aggravate fatigue and cause aches and pains. Try
adding a scoop of clean bone broth protein OR collagen
peptides to your Chia water. It is flavorless and a potent
anti-inflammatory. Superfoods for the win!

meals.name: Pea and Broccoli Korma
meals.instruction:
Add 2 tbsp oil to pan on a high heat
Once heated, add your chopped onion, garlic, chilli
and scallions. Cook for 2 minutes
Chop your red pepper into strips, broccoli into florets
and tomatoes into quarters and add to pan. Cook for
2 minutes and add the cumin seeds while the
broccoli starts to char
Pour in the coconut milk and chopped tomatoes with
the curry powder, salt, pepper and maple syrup.
Chop in the coriander along with the peas
Serve with a sprinkling of roasted cashews!

ingredients.name:
Partly skimmed milk, 2% M.F. (or
unsweetened soy milk)

meals.name:
Savory Spinach Steel Cut
Oatmeal
meals.instruction:
In a pot on the stove, bring milk and water to a boil
over high heat. Add steel-cut oats and return to a
boil.
Reduce the heat to low and stir ever couple of
minutes- it should barely bubble. Simmer for 20-25
minutes, until the oats are tender and creamy but
still have a bit of a bite.
Chop the spinach a bit and add it to the pot along
with the sea salt or Herbamere. Give everything a
stir and let the spinach wilt for a few minutes while
you prepare the eggs.
Fry your eggs to your liking and slice up the grape
tomatoes.
Assemble bowls by portioning 1/4 of the oat mixture
into a bowl, topping it with a fried egg, sliced
tomatoes, and a sprinkle of hemp hearts.

meals.name: Italian Orzo Salad
meals.instruction:
1. Wash and slice the spinach, basil, and mushrooms and
chop sun dried tomatoes. Place in the bottom of a pasta
strainer.
2.
A) If pasta was made ahead of time: Reheat reserved
cooking water in the microwave and pour over the
vegetable in the strainer (this will slightly cook them & add
some starchiness). Continue to step 3.
B) If pasta was not made ahead of time: Cook the orzo
according to package directions. When ready to drain, pour
the whole pot, orzo with water, over the veggies in the
bottom of the pasta strainer (this will slightly cook them &
add some starchiness).
3. Place pasta and vegetables in a big bowl. Add the rest of
the ingredients into the bowl and mix until well combined.
Portion into 4 mason jars and enjoy!
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Orzo, dry 567 gm
Instructions:
Cook the orzo according to package directions.
Drain, but reserve 1 cup of pasta water. Add 1 tsp
of olive oil to pasta to prevent sticking and store in
an airtight container in the fridge.

meals.name: Almond Crusted Salmon
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Brush salmon with honey. Chop almonds and sprinkle over
salmon.
Bake for 12-15 mins (until fish is opaque in centre).
Couple this with your favourite saut�ed veggie (ie. bok
choy).
Serve and enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Cumin (or other favorite spices and

herbs)

Garlic powder (or other favorite spices

and herbs)

Paprika, smoked (or other favorite

spices and herbs)

Chili powder (or other favorite spices

and herbs)

meals.name: Crispy Roasted Chickpeas
meals.instruction:
Heat the oven to 400�F: Place an oven rack in the
middle of the oven.
Rinse and drain the chickpeas: Open the cans of
chickpeas and pour the chickpeas into a strainer in
the sink. Rinse thoroughly under running water.
Dry the chickpeas: Pat the chickpeas very dry with a
clean dishtowel or paper towels. They should look
matte and feel dry to the touch; if you have time,
leave them to air-dry for a few minutes. Remove any
chickpea skins that come off while drying, but
otherwise don�t worry about them.
Toss the chickpeas with olive oil and salt: Spread the
chickpeas out in an even layer on the baking sheet.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Stir with
your hands or a spatula to make sure the chickpeas
are evenly coated.
Roast the chickpeas in the oven for 20 to 30
minutes: Stir the chickpeas or shake the pan every
10 minutes. A few chickpeas may pop � that�s
normal. The chickpeas are done when golden and
slightly darkened, dry and crispy on the outside, and
soft in the middle.
Toss the chickpeas with the spices: Sprinkle the
spices over the chickpeas and stir to coat evenly.
Serve while the chickpeas are still warm and crispy.
They will gradually lose their crispiness as they cool,
becoming addictively chewy.
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Chickpeas, raw 2/3 cup
Instructions:
Place the chickpeas in a bowl and cover with
plenty of water. Let soak for at least 8 hours, or
overnight. Drain and rinse well. Place in a large
pot, cover with water, bring to a boil and reduce to
simmer with the lid on for about 50 minutes. Drain
and store in a glass Tupperware in the fridge.

Blend all smoothie ingredients together. Pour into bowls.

mango, strawberries, banana, blueberries, chia seeds and
granola.
Enjoy!

meals.name:
AMAZING Black Bean
Brownies
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees and grease 8x8 baking pan.
Pulse oats in food processor until it creates a course or finer
flour.
Add all ingredients (except chocolate chips and process
until well mixed.
Mix in chocolate chips.
Spread mixture into a greased pan and bake for 15 minutes.
Toss in the fridge for 15 minutes to firm up if needed.

ingredients.name:
Atlantic salmon, wild (cut into 6 pieces

or 1 large piece)

meals.name: Salmon with Avocado Salsa Oven Baked
meals.instruction:
Pre-heat the oven to 400 degrees.
Mix the cumin, paprika, garlic powder, black pepper, and
a 1/4 pinch of sea salt.
Coat the salmon with olive oil, the seasoning mix, and the
sliced onions.
Next, cover the pan with a glass lid (parchment paper and
then aluminum foil on top, so the toxins from the aluminum
don't go in the fish).
Place in the oven and cook until done, about 15-20 minutes
depending on the thickness of the fish.
Avocado Salsa
Combine the avocado, onion*, cilantro, lime juice, and 1/2
pinch of sea salt in a bowl and mix well,
Raw onion can be hard to digest. If you are healing
your gut either sautee or steam the onion or leave them
out.
Top the cooked salmon with avocado salsa and enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Kale (de-stemmed and torn into pieces
- they will shrink in the dehydrator)

Cashew nuts, raw (or sunflower seeds -

soaked for 2 hours)

meals.name: Nacho Flavoured Kale Chips
meals.instruction:
Chop the red pepper into chunks and add to a blender with
the lemon juice. Blend until the pepper is broken down.
Add the cashews or sunflower seeds, red chili pepper flakes
and salt and again blend until smooth.
Add the nutritional yeast and blend again. Doing it in stages
like this helps you to get the smooth consistency you need
without over-heating it.
Put the kale in a large bowl then pour the blended mixture
over it and massage it in until all the leaves are coated.
Place it on dehydrator trays on mesh sheets and dehydrate
at 110 degrees Fahrenheit for about 8 hrs, turning once
halfway through. If they aren�t crispy enough, leave them in
a bit longer.
If you don't have a dehydrator, you can also roast your kale
chips in a 350-degree oven for 10 to 15 minutes. You run
the risk of them becoming a bit soggy with tis method,
however.
Note:
Cook time reflects cooking in the oven.

meals.instruction:

parchment paper.
Toss almonds with maple syrup, to coat, and spread in an
even layer on lined baking sheet.

ingredients.name:
Lettuce, romaine (chopped; or baby
spinach; or mixed greens)

meals.name:
Blueberry, Almond and
Feta Salad
meals.instruction:
Combine romaine, blueberries, cucumber, feta and
almonds in a large bowl.
Whisk together Dijon mustard, balsamic vinegar,
maple syrup and salt. Slowly pour in olive oil
whisking until completely combined and emulsified.
Portion the salad and top with 1�2 tablespoons of
dressing.

meals.name: Hard Boiled Eggs
meals.instruction:
1. Place eggs in saucepan and cover with water. Bring to
boil over high heat.
2. Once boiling, turn off heat but keep saucepan on the
burner. Cover and let sit for 10-12 minutes.
3. Strain the water and fill the saucepan with cold water. Let
eggs sit until cool enough to handle.
4. Peel off the shell and cut eggs as you wish, sprinkle salt
and pepper to taste

meals.name: Eggs and Toast
meals.instruction:
1. How to Hard Boil an Egg
2. Once your egg is boiled, peel and slice!
3. Toast your bread in the toasted to desired crispiness.
4. Add boiled eggs and salsa on top and Enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Chicken thighs, with skin (Organic if

available)

meals.name: Smoked Paprika & Turmeric Roast Chicken Thighs
meals.instruction:
Make marinade: Add olive oil, lime juice, ginger, turmeric,
garlic, smoked paprika, salt and sumac and whisk until
everything is combined.
Wash chicken and pat dry and put in a Ziploc bag, add all of
the marinade, close bag and massage until every piece of
chicken is covered with the marinade. Put chicken in the
fridge and let marinate for at least 24 hours.
Next day:
Pre-heat oven to 350�F and line a deep baking dish with
parchment paper. Pour the chicken plus marinade into the
baking sheet and bake for 2 hours
uncovered. When cooked remove from baking dish and put
on a serving platter, drizzle some of the pan juices on the
chicken thighs & and serve with your side of choice such as
Quinoa OR Rice.....YUMMY.

ingredients.name: Extra virgin olive oil (for frying fish)
Extra virgin olive oil (for pan sauce)

Italian herb seasoning, McCormick
(dried thyme; oregano; parsley)

meals.name:
Trout with Garlic Lemon
Butter Herb Sauce
meals.instruction:
Generously season both sides of fish fillets with
Italian herb seasoning, salt, and pepper.
In a large skillet (large enough to fit 2 fish fillets),
heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil on medium heat until
heated but not smoking. To the hot skillet with olive
oil, add fish fillets skin side up - flesh side down.
Cook the flesh side of the fish for about 3-5 minutes
on medium heat, making sure the oil does not
smoke, until lightly browned. Flip the fillets over to
the other side, skin side down (add more oil, if
needed). Cook for another 2-4 minutes. Remove the
skillet from heat, close with the lid, and let the fish
sit for 5-10 minutes, covered, in the skillet, until
flaky and cooked through completely.
After the fish is cooked through, using spatula,
carefully remove fillets to the plate, making sure to
leave all the cooking oils in the pan.
Add 1 tsp oil to the same pan with minced garlic,
lemon juice, and white wine. Cook on medium-low
heat for about 1 minute, until garlic softens a bit.
Remove from heat. Add 1 tablespoon of chopped
parsley, and 1 tablespoons of butter, off heat, to the
sauce, stirring, until the butter melts and forms a
creamy mixture.
Add fish to the pan, spoon sauce over the fish, top
the fish and sauce with the remaining 1 tablespoon
of parsley, and serve.

meals.name:
Sweet Potato Toast with
Almond Butter & Banana
meals.instruction:
Slice sweet potatoes lengthwise into 1/4 inch slices. Add to
the toaster like you would bread and toast on high. It may
take 2 rounds to get it cooked with a little bit a browning on
both sides.
Spread some almond butter on toast and add sliced banana
and a bit of cinnamon.
Enjoy!

meals.name: Mezze Bowls
meals.instruction:
Heat oven 425 F.
Slice zucchini, bell peppers, red onion and delicata squash
into even-sized pieces. Coat baking sheets in olive oil and
arrange vegetables on baking sheets. Place in the oven to
roast- about 15-20 minutes.
Make the hummus dressing by combining hummus, lemon
juice, olive oil, salt and pepper.
Combine chickpeas and hot sauce of choice in a small bowl.
Combine vegetables and chickpeas in a pan and add
spinach just long enough to wilt.
Arrange quinoa, spinach and roasted vegetables in bowls.
Top with chickpeas, hummus dressing and a sprinkling of
cilantro and any herbs of choice.

meals.name:
Fennel and Arugula Salad
with Oranges and Olives
meals.instruction:
Cut off rind and outer membrane of oranges.
Working over bowl, cut between membrane and pulp to
release segments into bowl, reserving juice for another use.
Add olives and fennel.
Pour in vinaigrette; toss to coat. Let stand for 15 minutes.
Add arugula; toss to coat.

Advanced Preparation
1 day prior [optional], Extra virgin olive oil 1/8 cup
Instructions:
Sherry Vinaigrette: In bowl, whisk oil, vinegar,
shallot, orange rind, honey, salt and pepper; set
aside. (Make-ahead: Cover and refrigerate until
you are ready to use.

meals.name: Hormone Balancing Granola
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 180�F.
Chop Brazil nuts and pecans in a food processor. Mix in a
bowl with all the other nuts, seeds, and coconut flakes.
Combine melted coconut oil, maple syrup, vanilla extract,
and cinnamon. Pour into the dry ingredients and mix until
everything is well-coated.
Place in the oven to cook for 30 minutes.

prefer)

meals.name: Balanced Green Smoothie
meals.instruction:
Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth
and pour into a tall clear glass.
Feel free to switch up the raspberries and greens for
alternatives.

meals.name:
Sliced Apples & Almond
Butter
meals.instruction:
1. Slice apple and sprinkle slices with cinnamon.

2. Dip in almond butter for a blood sugar balancing snack.
Enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Cumin (or other favorite spices and

herbs)

Garlic powder (or other favorite spices

and herbs)

Paprika, smoked (or other favorite

spices and herbs)

Chili powder (or other favorite spices

and herbs)

meals.name: Crispy Roasted Chickpeas
meals.instruction:
Heat the oven to 400�F: Place an oven rack in the
middle of the oven.
Rinse and drain the chickpeas: Open the cans of
chickpeas and pour the chickpeas into a strainer in
the sink. Rinse thoroughly under running water.
Dry the chickpeas: Pat the chickpeas very dry with a
clean dishtowel or paper towels. They should look
matte and feel dry to the touch; if you have time,
leave them to air-dry for a few minutes. Remove any
chickpea skins that come off while drying, but
otherwise don�t worry about them.
Toss the chickpeas with olive oil and salt: Spread the
chickpeas out in an even layer on the baking sheet.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Stir with
your hands or a spatula to make sure the chickpeas
are evenly coated.
Roast the chickpeas in the oven for 20 to 30
minutes: Stir the chickpeas or shake the pan every
10 minutes. A few chickpeas may pop � that�s
normal. The chickpeas are done when golden and
slightly darkened, dry and crispy on the outside, and
soft in the middle.
Toss the chickpeas with the spices: Sprinkle the
spices over the chickpeas and stir to coat evenly.
Serve while the chickpeas are still warm and crispy.
They will gradually lose their crispiness as they cool,
becoming addictively chewy.
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Chickpeas, raw 2/3 cup
Instructions:
Place the chickpeas in a bowl and cover with
plenty of water. Let soak for at least 8 hours, or
overnight. Drain and rinse well. Place in a large
pot, cover with water, bring to a boil and reduce to
simmer with the lid on for about 50 minutes. Drain
and store in a glass Tupperware in the fridge.

meals.name: Mezze Bowls
meals.instruction:
Heat oven 425 F.
Slice zucchini, bell peppers, red onion and delicata squash
into even-sized pieces. Coat baking sheets in olive oil and
arrange vegetables on baking sheets. Place in the oven to
roast- about 15-20 minutes.
Make the hummus dressing by combining hummus, lemon
juice, olive oil, salt and pepper.
Combine chickpeas and hot sauce of choice in a small bowl.
Combine vegetables and chickpeas in a pan and add
spinach just long enough to wilt.
Arrange quinoa, spinach and roasted vegetables in bowls.
Top with chickpeas, hummus dressing and a sprinkling of
cilantro and any herbs of choice.

ingredients.name:
Pasta, macaroni, elbow, whole wheat,

cooked

Red bell pepper (chopped, optional for
color)

meals.name:
Best Ever Vegan Mac &
Cheese
meals.instruction:
Place cashews in the food processor and finely grind
(just don�t let the cashews turn to a cashew butter).
Add red pepper and process until smooth. Set aside.
In a heavy saucepan, combine milk, oil and
cornstarch. Bring to a simmer over high heat.
Decrease heat to low, cover and simmer, stirring
occasionally for 10 minutes, or until cornstarch
dissolves.
Using a whisk or large fork, stir in the ground
cashews, nutritional yeast, miso paste, lemon juice,
onion powder, garlic powder and salt until well
combined.
Add the cashew cheese to the macaroni noodles,
drizzle with truffle oil (if using), a dash of freshly
ground black pepper and serve.

ingredients.name:
Quinoa, cooked (cook with vegetable

broth for more flavour)

Leek (finely chopped, light green and

white parts only)

meals.name:
Butternut, Carrot & Leek
Quiche with Quinoa Crust
meals.instruction:
Preheat the oven to 400 (F). Grease a 9 inch tart pan with coconut oil (or oil of choice).
For the crust: Combine the flax and water in a small bowl and set aside to thicken. Stir together the cooked quinoa, nutritional
yeast, coconut oil, and herbs. Add the flax mixture and mix until well combined. Press the mixture into prepared tart pan using your
hands. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden. Turn the oven heat down to 350 (F).
For the filling: In a large pan, heat coconut oil over medium-high heat. Add the garlic, leeks, carrots, and butternut squash. Saute,
stirring frequently, until carrots and squash are tender (about 8-10 minutes). Add spinach and stir until wilted. Remove pan from
heat. In a food processor, combine the remaining ingredients until very smooth. Transfer creamy mixture to a bowl and stir in
sauteed veggies. Spread the filling over the prepared crust and bake for about 35 minutes (the top should be golden). Garnish with
fresh sage. Allow to cool for at least 10 minutes before slicing.
Enjoy!

meals.name:
Toast With Refried Beans
and Avocado
meals.instruction:
Toast bread to the desired level of doneness.
Top with refried beans, avocado (mash with a fork if
desired) and sprinkle with salt.
Serve and enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Black beans, canned (1 1/2 cups -
drained and rinsed)

Maple syrup, pure (or honey - up to 1/3

cup)

meals.name:
AMAZING Black Bean
Brownies
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees and grease 8x8 baking pan.
Pulse oats in food processor until it creates a course or finer
flour.
Add all ingredients (except chocolate chips and process
until well mixed.
Mix in chocolate chips.
Spread mixture into a greased pan and bake for 15 minutes.
Toss in the fridge for 15 minutes to firm up if needed.

medium

meals.name: Eggs and Toast
meals.instruction:
1. How to Hard Boil an Egg
2. Once your egg is boiled, peel and slice!
3. Toast your bread in the toasted to desired crispiness.
4. Add boiled eggs and salsa on top and Enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Curly kale (Lacinato or whatever variety

you prefer)

White balsamic vinegar (or white wine

vinegar)

meals.name: Kale and Cabbage Slaw
meals.instruction:
Cut the middle rib out of each kale leaf. Roll the

leaves up into a tight roll and slice them chiffonade-
style into thin strips. Put the strips of kale in a large

bowl. You should have about 2 to 3 cups.
Cut the core out of the cabbage half and thinly shred
cabbage on a mandolin use a knife to thinly chop it.
Transfer the cabbage to the bowl with the kale.
Wash and peel the carrots. Julienne them into thin
matchstick (you can use a mandolin or a knife). Add
to the kale and cabbage.
Drizzle 2 to 3 tablespoons of the dressing over the
salad. Toss the salad. Cover and refrigerate until
serving time. Serve with the extra dressing on the
side.
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Dijon mustard, whole grain
3/4 tsp
Instructions:
In a mason jar or bowl, combine the Dijon mustard,
minced garlic, vinegar, and mayo. Whisk or shake
well. Add a dash of salt and some freshly ground
black pepper, to taste.

ingredients.name:
Chicken thighs, with skin (Organic if

available)

meals.name: Smoked Paprika & Turmeric Roast Chicken Thighs
meals.instruction:
Make marinade: Add olive oil, lime juice, ginger, turmeric,
garlic, smoked paprika, salt and sumac and whisk until
everything is combined.
Wash chicken and pat dry and put in a Ziploc bag, add all of
the marinade, close bag and massage until every piece of
chicken is covered with the marinade. Put chicken in the
fridge and let marinate for at least 24 hours.
Next day:
Pre-heat oven to 350�F and line a deep baking dish with
parchment paper. Pour the chicken plus marinade into the
baking sheet and bake for 2 hours
uncovered. When cooked remove from baking dish and put
on a serving platter, drizzle some of the pan juices on the
chicken thighs & and serve with your side of choice such as
Quinoa OR Rice.....YUMMY.

meals.name: Salmon with Avocado Salsa Oven Baked
meals.instruction:
Pre-heat the oven to 400 degrees.
Mix the cumin, paprika, garlic powder, black pepper, and
a 1/4 pinch of sea salt.
Coat the salmon with olive oil, the seasoning mix, and the
sliced onions.
Next, cover the pan with a glass lid (parchment paper and
then aluminum foil on top, so the toxins from the aluminum
don't go in the fish).
Place in the oven and cook until done, about 15-20 minutes
depending on the thickness of the fish.
Avocado Salsa
Combine the avocado, onion*, cilantro, lime juice, and 1/2
pinch of sea salt in a bowl and mix well,
Raw onion can be hard to digest. If you are healing
your gut either sautee or steam the onion or leave them
out.
Top the cooked salmon with avocado salsa and enjoy!

meals.name: Italian Orzo Salad
meals.instruction:
1. Wash and slice the spinach, basil, and mushrooms and
chop sun dried tomatoes. Place in the bottom of a pasta
strainer.
2.
A) If pasta was made ahead of time: Reheat reserved
cooking water in the microwave and pour over the
vegetable in the strainer (this will slightly cook them & add
some starchiness). Continue to step 3.
B) If pasta was not made ahead of time: Cook the orzo
according to package directions. When ready to drain, pour
the whole pot, orzo with water, over the veggies in the
bottom of the pasta strainer (this will slightly cook them &
add some starchiness).
3. Place pasta and vegetables in a big bowl. Add the rest of
the ingredients into the bowl and mix until well combined.
Portion into 4 mason jars and enjoy!
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Orzo, dry 567 gm
Instructions:
Cook the orzo according to package directions.
Drain, but reserve 1 cup of pasta water. Add 1 tsp
of olive oil to pasta to prevent sticking and store in
an airtight container in the fridge.

ingredients.name:
Partly skimmed milk, 2% M.F. (or
unsweetened soy milk)

meals.name:
Savory Spinach Steel Cut
Oatmeal
meals.instruction:
In a pot on the stove, bring milk and water to a boil
over high heat. Add steel-cut oats and return to a
boil.
Reduce the heat to low and stir ever couple of
minutes- it should barely bubble. Simmer for 20-25
minutes, until the oats are tender and creamy but
still have a bit of a bite.
Chop the spinach a bit and add it to the pot along
with the sea salt or Herbamere. Give everything a
stir and let the spinach wilt for a few minutes while
you prepare the eggs.
Fry your eggs to your liking and slice up the grape
tomatoes.
Assemble bowls by portioning 1/4 of the oat mixture
into a bowl, topping it with a fried egg, sliced
tomatoes, and a sprinkle of hemp hearts.

ingredients.name: Extra virgin olive oil (for frying fish)
Extra virgin olive oil (for pan sauce)

Italian herb seasoning, McCormick
(dried thyme; oregano; parsley)

meals.name:
Trout with Garlic Lemon
Butter Herb Sauce
meals.instruction:
Generously season both sides of fish fillets with
Italian herb seasoning, salt, and pepper.
In a large skillet (large enough to fit 2 fish fillets),
heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil on medium heat until
heated but not smoking. To the hot skillet with olive
oil, add fish fillets skin side up - flesh side down.
Cook the flesh side of the fish for about 3-5 minutes
on medium heat, making sure the oil does not
smoke, until lightly browned. Flip the fillets over to
the other side, skin side down (add more oil, if
needed). Cook for another 2-4 minutes. Remove the
skillet from heat, close with the lid, and let the fish
sit for 5-10 minutes, covered, in the skillet, until
flaky and cooked through completely.
After the fish is cooked through, using spatula,
carefully remove fillets to the plate, making sure to
leave all the cooking oils in the pan.
Add 1 tsp oil to the same pan with minced garlic,
lemon juice, and white wine. Cook on medium-low
heat for about 1 minute, until garlic softens a bit.
Remove from heat. Add 1 tablespoon of chopped
parsley, and 1 tablespoons of butter, off heat, to the
sauce, stirring, until the butter melts and forms a
creamy mixture.
Add fish to the pan, spoon sauce over the fish, top
the fish and sauce with the remaining 1 tablespoon
of parsley, and serve.

meals.name: Pea and Broccoli Korma
meals.instruction:
Add 2 tbsp oil to pan on a high heat
Once heated, add your chopped onion, garlic, chilli
and scallions. Cook for 2 minutes
Chop your red pepper into strips, broccoli into florets
and tomatoes into quarters and add to pan. Cook for
2 minutes and add the cumin seeds while the
broccoli starts to char
Pour in the coconut milk and chopped tomatoes with
the curry powder, salt, pepper and maple syrup.
Chop in the coriander along with the peas
Serve with a sprinkling of roasted cashews!

meals.name:
Green Beans with Walnuts
and Onions
meals.instruction:
Cut off green beans ends, boil green beans 3-4 minutes.
In a large skillet, heat half of the olive oil over medium heat
and cook onions, stirring, for 5 minutes. Add walnuts and
garlic and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes.
Add the remaining oil and green beans. Season with salt
and pepper, stir and cook for 2 minutes.
Serve as an appetizer or with parboiled rice to make a
complete meal.

Toast With Refried Beans
and Avocado
meals.instruction:
Toast bread to the desired level of doneness.
Top with refried beans, avocado (mash with a fork if
desired) and sprinkle with salt.
Serve and enjoy!

meals.name: Brain-Adrenal Balancing Smoothie

Sweet Potato Toast with
Almond Butter & Banana
meals.instruction:
Slice sweet potatoes lengthwise into 1/4 inch slices. Add to
the toaster like you would bread and toast on high. It may
take 2 rounds to get it cooked with a little bit a browning on
both sides.
Spread some almond butter on toast and add sliced banana
and a bit of cinnamon.
Enjoy!

and cook onions, stirring, for 5 minutes. Add walnuts and
garlic and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes.
Add the remaining oil and green beans. Season with salt
and pepper, stir and cook for 2 minutes.
Serve as an appetizer or with parboiled rice to make a
complete meal.

Pasta, macaroni, elbow, whole wheat,

cooked

Red bell pepper (chopped, optional for
color)

meals.name:
Best Ever Vegan Mac &
Cheese
meals.instruction:
Place cashews in the food processor and finely grind
(just don�t let the cashews turn to a cashew butter).
Add red pepper and process until smooth. Set aside.
In a heavy saucepan, combine milk, oil and
cornstarch. Bring to a simmer over high heat.
Decrease heat to low, cover and simmer, stirring
occasionally for 10 minutes, or until cornstarch
dissolves.
Using a whisk or large fork, stir in the ground
cashews, nutritional yeast, miso paste, lemon juice,
onion powder, garlic powder and salt until well
combined.
Add the cashew cheese to the macaroni noodles,
drizzle with truffle oil (if using), a dash of freshly
ground black pepper and serve.

meals.instruction:
Make marinade: Add olive oil, lime juice, ginger, turmeric,
garlic, smoked paprika, salt and sumac and whisk until
everything is combined.
Wash chicken and pat dry and put in a Ziploc bag, add all of
the marinade, close bag and massage until every piece of
chicken is covered with the marinade. Put chicken in the
fridge and let marinate for at least 24 hours.
Next day:
Pre-heat oven to 350�F and line a deep baking dish with
parchment paper. Pour the chicken plus marinade into the
baking sheet and bake for 2 hours
uncovered. When cooked remove from baking dish and put
on a serving platter, drizzle some of the pan juices on the
chicken thighs & and serve with your side of choice such as
Quinoa OR Rice.....YUMMY.

meals.name: Pea and Broccoli Korma
meals.instruction:
Add 2 tbsp oil to pan on a high heat
Once heated, add your chopped onion, garlic, chilli
and scallions. Cook for 2 minutes
Chop your red pepper into strips, broccoli into florets
and tomatoes into quarters and add to pan. Cook for
2 minutes and add the cumin seeds while the
broccoli starts to char
Pour in the coconut milk and chopped tomatoes with
the curry powder, salt, pepper and maple syrup.
Chop in the coriander along with the peas
Serve with a sprinkling of roasted cashews!

Brownies

Pulse oats in food processor until it creates a course or finer
flour.

until well mixed.
Mix in chocolate chips.
Spread mixture into a greased pan and bake for 15 minutes.
Toss in the fridge for 15 minutes to firm up if needed.

cilantro and any herbs of choice.

ingredients.name:
Kale (de-stemmed and torn into pieces
- they will shrink in the dehydrator)

Cashew nuts, raw (or sunflower seeds -

soaked for 2 hours)

meals.name: Nacho Flavoured Kale Chips
meals.instruction:
Chop the red pepper into chunks and add to a blender with
the lemon juice. Blend until the pepper is broken down.
Add the cashews or sunflower seeds, red chili pepper flakes
and salt and again blend until smooth.
Add the nutritional yeast and blend again. Doing it in stages
like this helps you to get the smooth consistency you need
without over-heating it.
Put the kale in a large bowl then pour the blended mixture
over it and massage it in until all the leaves are coated.
Place it on dehydrator trays on mesh sheets and dehydrate
at 110 degrees Fahrenheit for about 8 hrs, turning once
halfway through. If they aren�t crispy enough, leave them in
a bit longer.
If you don't have a dehydrator, you can also roast your kale
chips in a 350-degree oven for 10 to 15 minutes. You run
the risk of them becoming a bit soggy with tis method,
however.
Note:
Cook time reflects cooking in the oven.

meals.name: Brain-Adrenal Balancing Smoothie
meals.instruction:
Combine everything in a blender until smooth.
Serve and enjoy!

meals.name: Raw Muesli with Greek Yoghurt and Berries
meals.instruction:
1. Add ingredients to suitable glass container and mix well.
2. Add two tablespoons of muesli to a bowl and add 1/4 cup
almond milk, 1 tablespoon of Greek yoghurt (or coconut
yogurt if you want to go dairy free), and 1/4 cup of frozen
berries, defrosted.
Enjoy!

Fennel and Arugula Salad
with Oranges and Olives
meals.instruction:
Cut off rind and outer membrane of oranges.
Working over bowl, cut between membrane and pulp to
release segments into bowl, reserving juice for another use.
Add olives and fennel.
Pour in vinaigrette; toss to coat. Let stand for 15 minutes.
Add arugula; toss to coat.

meals.name: Kale and Cabbage Slaw
meals.instruction:
Cut the middle rib out of each kale leaf. Roll the

leaves up into a tight roll and slice them chiffonade-
style into thin strips. Put the strips of kale in a large

bowl. You should have about 2 to 3 cups.
Cut the core out of the cabbage half and thinly shred
cabbage on a mandolin use a knife to thinly chop it.
Transfer the cabbage to the bowl with the kale.
Wash and peel the carrots. Julienne them into thin
matchstick (you can use a mandolin or a knife). Add
to the kale and cabbage.
Drizzle 2 to 3 tablespoons of the dressing over the
salad. Toss the salad. Cover and refrigerate until
serving time. Serve with the extra dressing on the
side.
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Dijon mustard, whole grain
3/4 tsp
Instructions:

minced garlic, vinegar, and mayo. Whisk or shake
well. Add a dash of salt and some freshly ground
black pepper, to taste.

meals.name: Salmon with Avocado Salsa Oven Baked
meals.instruction:
Pre-heat the oven to 400 degrees.
Mix the cumin, paprika, garlic powder, black pepper, and
a 1/4 pinch of sea salt.
Coat the salmon with olive oil, the seasoning mix, and the
sliced onions.
Next, cover the pan with a glass lid (parchment paper and
then aluminum foil on top, so the toxins from the aluminum
don't go in the fish).
Place in the oven and cook until done, about 15-20 minutes
depending on the thickness of the fish.
Avocado Salsa
Combine the avocado, onion*, cilantro, lime juice, and 1/2
pinch of sea salt in a bowl and mix well,
Raw onion can be hard to digest. If you are healing
your gut either sautee or steam the onion or leave them
out.
Top the cooked salmon with avocado salsa and enjoy!

Extra virgin olive oil (for pan sauce)

Italian herb seasoning, McCormick
(dried thyme; oregano; parsley)

meals.name:
Trout with Garlic Lemon
Butter Herb Sauce
meals.instruction:
Generously season both sides of fish fillets with
Italian herb seasoning, salt, and pepper.
In a large skillet (large enough to fit 2 fish fillets),
heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil on medium heat until
heated but not smoking. To the hot skillet with olive
oil, add fish fillets skin side up - flesh side down.
Cook the flesh side of the fish for about 3-5 minutes
on medium heat, making sure the oil does not
smoke, until lightly browned. Flip the fillets over to
the other side, skin side down (add more oil, if
needed). Cook for another 2-4 minutes. Remove the
skillet from heat, close with the lid, and let the fish
sit for 5-10 minutes, covered, in the skillet, until
flaky and cooked through completely.
After the fish is cooked through, using spatula,
carefully remove fillets to the plate, making sure to
leave all the cooking oils in the pan.
Add 1 tsp oil to the same pan with minced garlic,
lemon juice, and white wine. Cook on medium-low
heat for about 1 minute, until garlic softens a bit.
Remove from heat. Add 1 tablespoon of chopped
parsley, and 1 tablespoons of butter, off heat, to the
sauce, stirring, until the butter melts and forms a
creamy mixture.
Add fish to the pan, spoon sauce over the fish, top
the fish and sauce with the remaining 1 tablespoon
of parsley, and serve.

meals.name:
Sweet Potato Toast with
Almond Butter & Banana
meals.instruction:
Slice sweet potatoes lengthwise into 1/4 inch slices. Add to
the toaster like you would bread and toast on high. It may
take 2 rounds to get it cooked with a little bit a browning on
both sides.
Spread some almond butter on toast and add sliced banana
and a bit of cinnamon.
Enjoy!
